decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
REASON:  To comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents: Reasonable Exemption Statement; Heritage Statement; Initial Bat Assessment; Site Location Plan; 198/PP/001a; 198/PP/002b; 198/PP/003a; 198/PP/004b; 198/PP/0015.
REASON: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the extension hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building.
REASON: To safeguard the character and appearance of the area in accordance with Core Policy CS1.B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012) and Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013).

Condition : 4 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that order with or without modification), no window(s)/door(s), other than those shown on the approved plans shall be installed in the flank elevation(s) of the development hereby permitted without the prior permission in writing of the local planning authority.

REASON: To safeguard the residential  amenities of neighbouring residents, in accordance with Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013).

Condition : 5 - The window(s) in the flank elevation(s) of the proposed development shall:
(a) be of purpose-made obscure glass,
(b) be permanently fixed closed below a height of 1.7m above finished floor level,
and shall thereafter be retained in that form.
REASON: To safeguard the residential  amenities of neighbouring residents, in accordance with Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013).

Condition : 6 - The roof area of the extension hereby permitted shall not be used as a balcony, roof garden or similar amenity area without the grant of further specific permission from the local planning authority.
REASON: To safeguard the residential  amenities of neighbouring residents, in accordance with Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013).

Condition : 7 - 1. Prior to commencement, the applicant will provide to the Council for approval in writing a proportionate methods statement that will set out how measures will be implemented to:

a.  prevent disturbance to breeding birds or their nests, eggs, and young whether in/on the house or adjacent vegetation. This should either be by commencing works outside of the bird breeding season (which runs from March through August for most species), or ensuring that a competent individual undertakes a search of the areas likely to be impacted, no more than 36 hours before works are due to commence. Should any birds be found to be nesting within 5 metres of the area prior to or during works, operations shall cease until either an ecologist has been consulted and any appropriate measures implemented under their guidance or until the young have fledged and left the nest. 

b. prevent disturbance to bats and their prey from artificial illumination to be used during construction

c. actions to take should any bats be found in the course of the approved works e.g. with regard to consulting a qualified ecologist before proceeding further

d. ensure that contractors and their overseers 
     i. are aware of legal requirements and penalties
     ii. will implement these instructions  

The methods statement should provide certainty with regard to the handling of these matters and the subsequent works will need to be conducted in accordance with the statement hereby approved.

Condition : 8 - Any external illumination installed as part of the scheme or subsequently shall, by the type the type, design and positioning of lighting units and control systems, avoid or otherwise minimise disturbance to the activity of nocturnal species,  with particular regard to bats and their use of the SINC, its margins, and any natural or artificial roosting features.

REASON: For the purposes of proper planning, to avoid uncertainty, to protect and provide measurable enhancement for biodiversity in accordance with local and national planning policies and to secure sustainable development.

Condition : 9 - The applicant will, subject to approval in writing from the Council with regard to the location and shelter type, install and permanently retain two Schwegler 2FTR universal bat shelters (or functional equivalents) on the SE aspect of the existing building at just below roof eaves level, prior to first use of the extended living areas.  

REASON: For the purposes of proper planning, to avoid uncertainty, to protect and provide measurable enhancement for biodiversity in accordance with local and national planning policies and to secure sustainable development.

Condition : 10 - The applicant will, subject to details to be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, prior to works proceeding above dpc level, provide and permanently maintain within the rear garden, either
a geo-textile clay liner pond, fed from the extended roof of adequate size to provide SuDS capacity to reduce the overall rate of flow of water from the development site and provide added value for biodiversity, through appropriate design and choice of plants 
or
three deciduous shrubs or fruit trees that will provide water capture, evapo-transpiration and biodiversity benefits.

REASON: For the purposes of proper planning, to avoid uncertainty, to protect and provide measurable enhancement for biodiversity in accordance with local and national planning policies and to secure sustainable development.
description: Single and two storey rear extension; external alterations (demolition of rear extension)
